trial_identification.studytitle: A proof of concept, single centre, monotherapy, dose-ranging trial to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of CB0011 at 0,7.5, 15, 30 and 45mg in Obstructive Sleep Apnea.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A proof of concept, single centre, monotherapy, dose-ranging trial to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of CB0011 at 0,7.5, 15, 30 and 45mg in Obstructive Sleep Apnea.

interventions.interventions: A six week cross-over design study in patients with Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA). Patients (n=42) will be randomly enrolled into one of six dose sequence groups at an equivalent ratio.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in Obstructive Sleep Apnea as measured by the patient apnea hypopnea index score (AHI).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Parameters measured at baseline, week two, week four and week six (or early termination) by overnight polysomnography and between three and five nights per week by patients utilising an ambulatory home monitoring device.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in Obstructive Sleep Apnea as measured by the respiratory disturbance index (RDI).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Parameters measured at baseline, week two, week four and week six (or early termination) by overnight polysomnography and between three and five nights per week by patients utilising an ambulatory home monitoring device.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in Obstructive Sleep Apnea as measured by oxygen desaturation index (ODI).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Parameters measured at baseline, week two, week four and week six (or early termination) by overnight polysomnography and between three and five nights per week by patients utilising an ambulatory home monitoring device.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Changes in daytime sedation, sleep quality, mood, fatigue and weight.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline, week two, week four and week six.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Early termination and quality of life.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at baseline and week six or early termination.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects must have a current diagnosis of Obstructive Sleep Apnea, have an apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) of between 10-40 (using a strict definition of hypopnea), with a calculated BMI equal or less than 40 at the time of study entry.

trial_design.sequence: block allocation to dose sequence and customised computer sequence generation

contact.name: Associate Professor Ron Grunstein
